body_text: Does each Sohmas' appearance correlate to a fruit? In Fruits Basket, the game fruits basket is symbolic, representing how Tohru--who is assigned the onigiri, which is not a fruit--never fits in. It can be extended to say that it represents that she will never fit in with the Sohmas, as shown in this question. Does then each Sohma have an appearance that correlates to a fruit, continuing the symbol?

What is the meaning of the title of Fruits Basket? The title of "Fruits Basket" seems to imply that there is some basket with fruits in it which is somehow relevant to the story. However, I imagine that a story about a literal basket of fruits would not be very interesting.
What is the significance of the title? Is it referencing a literal basket of fruits or is it symbolizing something else?
